DOC.brief_summary: Rehabilitation approach introduce stimulus motor system , goal enhance motor function patient . For example , exposure brief intermittent episode mild hypoxia show strengthen synaptic pathway respiratory skeletal muscle motor neuron . In human spinal cord injury , exposure intermittent hypoxia ( IH ) alone combination rehabilitative strategy show enhanced motor function . Another strategy know inspiratory threshold loading , involve breathe pressure threshold load , result improve inspiratory muscle strength . Although evidence support use IH alone combination rehabilitative strategy improve motor function human , impact exposure IH IH inspiratory threshold load inspiratory muscle function ventilation human unknown .
DOC.brief_title: Intermittent Hypoxia Inspiratory Threshold Loading Enhance Inspiratory Muscle Function
DOC.detailed_description: Investigators test whether exposure IH alone combination inspiratory threshold loading ( ITL ) result increase inspiratory muscle strength ventilation . Investigators use Latin square , repeat measure design consist 12 subject participate four experimental conditions.There interval 1 week four condition , serve washout period . At end 5 session , subject rest recline chair 15 minute heart rate , blood pressure , oxygen saturation breathing monitor . Subjects blood systolic blood pressure > 140 diastolic pressure > 90 SPO2 < 92 % ask remain laboratory 15 additional minute vital sign repeat . If blood pressure and/or peripheral capillary oxygen saturation ( SPO2 ) remain outside criterion mention , subject instruct seek assessment health provider incident report Institutional Review Board . Subjects also ask report discomfort .
DOC.criteria: Participating three few musculoskeletal strength training session per week intensity equivalent 710 Modified Borg 's scale Participating three few cardiovascular endurance training session per week intensity equivalent 710 Modified Borg 's scale Diagnosis cardiovascular disease ( Hypertension , arrhythmia , coronary artery disease , congenital valvar heart disease ) Diagnosis neuromuscular disease Diagnosis neurological disease Presence concurrent medical illness include infection , fracture Diagnosis obstructive sleep apnea Diagnosis obstructive/restrictive lung disease Diagnosis exercise induce asthma Forced expiratory volume one second/forced vital capacity ( FVC ) < 80 % and/or FVC < 80 % predict value indicate airway obstruction Subjects prednisolone therapy selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor ( SSRI ) therapy exclude study .
